Data: Johnson to Elgar, no run pitched up, worked away eagerly but right to short leg, cannot get that single
Johnson to Elgar, no run here comes the short ball, right at the throat, Elgar keeps it down well in the end, off the glove
Johnson to Elgar, no run moving away from a good length now, he is again staying in the crease and letting it go
Johnson to Elgar, no run playing a pitched up delivery from the crease, drops it softly to the off

Johnson to Elgar, OUT Mitchell Johnson has deserved this wicket, if not a couple more today, he's had Elgar expecting the short ball, sent in a few pitched up deliveries, and now he digs it into the body, it doesn't rise too much, Elgar pulls awkwardly, Wade settles under the tame top-edge
Johnson to Peterson, no run and he almost gets another one, full, quick, and nearly shaves the off stump, after beating the left-hander
Hastings to du Plessis, no run left alone as it bounces outside off

Hastings to du Plessis, no run right forward, head on top of ball to defend
Hastings to du Plessis, no run coming in now from outside off, left alone
Hastings to du Plessis, no run more inward movement, allows it go past once again
Hastings to du Plessis, no run good length, straight, and wide outside off, left alone

Johnson to Peterson, no run gets out of the way of a 140 kph bouncer outside off

Johnson to Peterson, no run beaten, on the drive, with a pitched up ball that leaves him a shade

Watson to du Plessis, no run Umpire Rauf shakes his head, Australia are reviewing a lbw appeal, pitched up, angled in, there are two noises, one of them is bat hitting pad, the other of ball crashing into pad, ball tracker, however, shows it sliding just down leg, and Australia lose the review,
Watson to du Plessis, 1 run clipped off the pad through midwicket

Lyon to Peterson, no run width, but cut straight to point
Hastings to du Plessis, no run on the front foot to defend, but is surprised as it rises a bit from good length, pushes awkwardly at it

Lyon to Peterson, OUT Lyon has struck, against the run of play, short of a length delivery, wide too, there to be cut, but it kicks and turns, Peterson chases it and edges it through to Wade, who had moved into position behind the line very well
Lyon to Philander, no run defended off the front foot, off a thick inside edge
Lyon to Philander, no run stays in the crease, allows it to spin in, and blocks

Johnson to Philander, no run Johnson returns and beats him with a length ball on off stump, his line has been alright today
Johnson to Philander, no run full and straight on the stumps, defended
Johnson to Philander, no run gets low to keep out a pitched up ball outside off
Johnson to Philander, no run opens up to a length ball and blocks it tidily
Johnson to Philander, no run drives but closes the face and bowler fields the full delivery
Johnson to Philander, no run angled some way outside off and he is not playing it

Johnson to Philander, no run he is wary of the ball rearing up at him, wanted to duck initially, then saw it was not as short, tried to defend even as he was crouching, fended it off the glove
Johnson to Philander, 1 run sharp single with a nudge towards midwicket
Johnson to du Plessis, no run leaves alone an angled delivery outside off

Lyon to du Plessis, no run defended off the front foot and that will be tea

Johnson to du Plessis, no run forward to defend a pitched up delivery

Johnson to du Plessis, no run he is wiser third time and allows it go across with the angle

Johnson to du Plessis, no run full delivery, he pushes firmly, but extra cover cuts it off
Johnson to du Plessis, FOUR runs crack! lovely stroke, Johnson bangs it in short, Faf swivels, and controls the pull along the ground to easily beat the man in the deep at square leg

Hastings to du Plessis, no run defended off the front foot

Johnson to du Plessis, no run tight line from Johnson, just on off stump, fullish length, blocked

Johnson to du Plessis, no run and then he is beaten on the forward push with a similar delivery, Johnson has hands on his head
Johnson to du Plessis, no run slightly closer to off stump, pitched up length again, this time he is right behind it

Watson to du Plessis, no run takes a step outside off and shoulders arms to a length ball

Johnson to Steyn, OUT Johnson strikes, Steyn wanted to leave that back of a length delivery, but was late on the decision, the ball takes the inside edge and crashes into the stumps even as Steyn was raising his bat
Johnson to Morkel, FOUR runs Morne gets a short and wide delivery and cuts it hard to the deep point rope
Johnson to Morkel, FOUR runs more width, more runs, Morne punches it past gully for four more
Johnson to Morkel, FOUR runs he's piling up the boundaries, Morne, now Johnson goes full, and outside off, Morne drills it through extra cover
Johnson to Morkel, no run gets behind the line of a good length ball now to defend to the off side

Johnson to Morkel, no run well played, gets on his toes and pushes a shortish one to point
Johnson to Morkel, FOUR runs whoa, Morne has picked that pitched up delivery, a slower one, from outside off, and heaved it past mid on
Johnson to Morkel, no run that was headed full for off stump, but Morne got the bat down in time

Johnson to Morkel, no run tries to pull a 142.2 kph short ball, beaten for pace and bounce
Lyon to du Plessis, no run that hurried on outside off, Faf was getting across and brought bat down quickly to defend

Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run too wide, and thumped away, but straight to deep point
Lyon to Morkel, no run goes back to defend a flighted ball on off
Lyon to Morkel, no run right forward now to block a length ball
Lyon to Morkel, OUT oh Morne, he sees a bit of flight on off, and swats it straight to mid on, third for Lyon

Faf du Plessis goes back on a Test average of 266, and the last four SA wickets have tripled the score from 75 to 225. There was some help for the bowlers early on, but it is still not a wicket where you get bowled out for 225 on day one of a Test.
Right, 14 overs remain for the day, Warner and Cowan are out to face the new ball, which is with Steyn. There are three slips
Steyn to Warner, no run hello, Warner flashes at a wide delivery outside off stump, and misses by miles
Steyn to Warner, 3 runs good length, a push away from the body has Warner away, in the air for a while, but in the gap past cover

Steyn to Cowan, OUT there is the outside edge and Dale Steyn has needed three balls to strike, Cowan stretching right forward to defend, it is a big stretch, the angle was taking the length delivery away from him, much like what happened to Smith, old man Kallis gobbles up the low catch at second slip
Steyn to Watson, FOUR runs they keep going for their shots, after Warner, it is Watson, no width at all, but Watson steers it ODI style between slips and gully
Steyn to Watson, no run and again, wide delivery moving further away, Watson has a quite loose waft at it from the crease
Steyn to Watson, 1 run that squared him up, what a start, angled in to the pads, Watson shapes up to work it to leg, it swings and straightens, and a thick edge runs to the off side
Philander to Watson, no run straightening from a length, right on off stump, defended
Philander to Watson, no run he is playing for the movement, but ends up pushing outside the line as it carries straight on, misses the edge, misses the off stump, both by inches
Philander to Watson, no run sends it down the leg side now
Philander to Watson, 1 run into the pads from back of a length, tucked to fine leg
Philander to Warner, 1 run swinging in full for the stumps, inside edge down to fine leg as he pushes at it
Philander to Watson, no run zipping away from a length, 135 kph, South African new ball bowlers looking a lot more threatening, Watson plays well inside the line
Steyn to Warner, no run that looked a lot quicker than 134.7 kph as it zoomed close to off stump, good length, Warner, for once, had nothing to do with it
Steyn to Warner, no run good length again, making him play this time, defended off the back foot
Steyn to Warner, no run left alone outside off as it moves away a tad
Steyn to Warner, no run nearly got him there, that swung in full and late, Warner shaped up for the drive, inside edged it onto pad
Steyn to Warner, no run pegged back with a 138 kph length ball swirling in, stabs it out
Steyn to Warner, no run that moved away from the left-hander, after pitching around leg, leading edge towards covers is all Warner managed
Philander to Watson, no run
Philander to Watson, 1 run worked to square leg for one
Philander to Warner, no run stays in the crease and defends a length ball to extra cover
Philander to Warner, no run good length, pushed out to covers
Philander to Warner, no run that took off, back of a length, outside off, Warner prodded at it and hopped as he was beaten
Philander to Warner, no run decides to let it go this time outside off, 130 kph good length from Philander
Steyn to Watson, 3 runs angled in and carries into the pads, worked square and stopped just inside
Steyn to Warner, no run bouncer now, he avoids it
Steyn to Warner, no run pitched up very close to off stump, Warner thinks about it, and shoulders arms after getting across
Steyn to Warner, no run bowled full and wide outside off, Warner went after it, but could not connect
Steyn to Warner, no run moves across and works a length ball off middle to square leg
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs shot, Warner gets one away, Steyn gives him enough width and angle on the length ball to come forward and put it away through extra cover

Philander to Watson, OUT huge, long appeal for lbw, Philander kept appealing and almost reached the other end, umpire Rauf does not move, Smith goes for a review, length ball, Watson forward to block, it moves in to beat the bat and strike pad below knee roll, no doubt about that, it is hitting middle
Philander to Lyon, no run straightens on middle stump, Lyon shuffles about and gets behind the line
Philander to Lyon, 4 leg byes into the pads, and helped on its way softly
Philander to Lyon, no run hint of straightening once again, Lyon blocks it out solidly
Philander to Lyon, no run and again, he is getting behind the line early to defend these good length balls
Philander to Lyon, 2 runs thick edge as he pushes forward to one outside off, runs past gully
Steyn to Warner, no run bends the knees and pulls head out of the way of a climber outside off
Steyn to Warner, no run a push, and a miss, as Warner goes forward reaching out for a pitched up ball that leaves him with the angle
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs tentatively playing at it from the crease, thick edge as the length ball moves away, and flies past gully
Steyn to Warner, no run defended to short extra cover from the crease
Steyn to Warner, no run fine leave, full and close to off, he watches it closely and raises the bat
Steyn to Warner, no run beaten once more, Warner affords himself a smile, Steyn smiles back, pitched up for the drive but Warner cannot connect
Philander to Lyon, no run Lyon shuffles across and defends a length ball intently
Philander to Lyon, no run good length once more, and no issues in getting behind to defend
Philander to Lyon, no run pitched up this time, but Lyon is watching them very closely, blocks again
Philander to Lyon, no run back of a length, he goes across and brings it down very calmly
Philander to Lyon, 3 runs fullish, Lyon pushes forward defensively and gets it past short mid off, stopped just inside
Philander to Warner, no run length ball worked to midwicket
Steyn to Lyon, no run nasty, 139 kph short ball that Lyon somehow manages to crouch under, almost took his elbow out
Steyn to Lyon, no run full delivery, on off stump, Lyon has handled it well, defending towards cover
Steyn to Lyon, no run pitched up, thick outside edge runs to gully along the ground
Steyn to Lyon, no run phew, Steyn is pounding in and peppering Lyon with bouncers, he just survives this one
Steyn to Lyon, no run 137.6 kph pitched up ball dealt with quite well, big forward stride out to block
Steyn to Lyon, no run straightens on middle stump, would have tested most specialist batsmen, Lyon is determined to see out the day though, more solid defence
Morkel to Warner, no run back of a length outside off, pushed out to cover-point
Morkel to Warner, no run that popped up but fell just short of square leg, Morne sending into Warner, and it took the thigh pad as Warner hopped
Morkel to Warner, no run more jumping around for Warner, he is not comfortable with this shortish stuff into the body at the moment, takes another blow
Morkel to Warner, no run outside off this time, back of a length again, Warner gets out of the way
Morkel to Warner, no run and the pitched up delivery has him pushing forward awkwardly and missing
Morkel to Warner, no run fine leave, not far from off stump, angle taking it away, Warner sizes it all up as he gets across, covers the stumps, and raises the bat
Steyn to Lyon, no run that was close, Lyon beaten now, the length ball has zipped past his prod from the crease
Steyn to Lyon, no run one of the very few that haven't carried to the cordon, Lyon not lunging hard to defend, pushes soft ly at the length ball
Steyn to Lyon, no run too good, angled in, 143 kph, and zips out sharply, Lyon
Steyn to Lyon, no run oh well, another forward push, another miss, Lyon smiles, and walks up to Warner to ensure this will be the last over for the day
Steyn to Lyon, no run straight on to off stump now, Lyon crouches forward to keep it out, and the WACA erupts in applause, one more to go
Steyn to Lyon, 2 runs pitched up, a push, shouts of catch it, dramatic end to the day, mid off is too short, Lyon collects a couple, shoves bat under his arm and starts the walk back
Philander to Warner, no run goes back and defends back to the bowler
Philander to Warner, no run bowls down the leg side and he misses it completely
Philander to Warner, 1 run drifts on the pads and he tucks it behind square on the on side
Philander to Lyon, no run lands it outside off and he leaves it alone to the kepeer
Philander to Lyon, no run that's a beauty from Vernon! Just leaves the right-hander late, pokes his bat out at it
Philander to Lyon, no run touch wider outside off and he safely lets this one go

Steyn to Warner, OUT Appeal for a caught behind and he's been given out but Warner wants to review this! It was a loose drive outside off, slightly wide, Warner couldn't resist, de Villiers and the rest went up, Warner hesitated for a while and then reviewed after consulting Lyon, there was a noise, t
Steyn to Ponting, no run nearly chipped it straight to the fielder! Oh well, he survives, swings it on the pads and he shuffled and chipped it just in front of midwicket
Steyn to Ponting, 1 run squared him up a bit and he awkwardly pushes it towards short cover and sets off, claps all around for Ricky
Steyn to Clarke, no run solid in defense, hones in on the off stump and he blocks it out
Steyn to Clarke, no run this was fuller in length and he pushes it down to mid-off
Philander to Ponting, 3 runs that Ponting pull! Bangs it slightly short, picked it from outside off and pulls in front of square, didn't quite find the boundary
Philander to Clarke, no run fuller in length and defended back towards the bowler
Philander to Clarke, no run good length moving away from him and he safely leaves it alone
Philander to Clarke, no run just moves away from the right-hander and he withdraws the bat late
Philander to Clarke, no run shuffles a few paces across and pats it towards the bowler
Philander to Clarke, 1 run just strays on the pads and he tucks it down towards fine leg
Steyn to Clarke, no run slightly short of a length and he defends high on the bat
Steyn to Clarke, no run just strays down the leg side and he tries to flick it away towards fine leg and misses
Steyn to Clarke, 3 runs strays on the body and he tucks it wide of mid-on and the fielder misfields, Ponting's back on strike
Steyn to Ponting, no run well left, this one held its line before reaching the keeper, just landed on a good length
Steyn to Ponting, no run this one too held its line before reaching the keeper, de Villiers hopped a bit while collecting it
Steyn to Ponting, no run gets across and punches it down the track
Philander to Clarke, 1 run fuller in length and swinging towards the pads and he works it down to fine leg

Philander to Ponting, OUT Appeal for an LBW and he's been given! But Ponting's reviewing it. And Ponting loses out on the review because the third umpire is convinced that was hitting. Here's how it happened - Ponting was well across his stumps to defend, the ball swung in and hit him just below the t
Philander to Hussey, no run stays back at the crease and knocks it towards point
Philander to Hussey, 2 runs gets off the mark with a front foot punch towards deep cover
Philander to Hussey, no run tries to work it to the leg side and he gets a leading edge towards point
Philander to Hussey, no run keeps it outside off and he safely leaves it alone
Steyn to Clarke, no run good bouncer! Clarke bends backwards and he weaves out of the way

Steyn to Clarke, OUT Steyn's got the Big Fish with a peach! Clarke was all squared up there, good length on middle and off and moving away slightly, it was fired in at good pace and Ckarke had no time to get across and cover the line, just got the outside edge and taken by de Villiers, Australia 6 for
Steyn to Wade, no run Wade gets across and leaves it alone to the keeper
Steyn to Wade, no run moves across and fuller and he defends it to the off side
Steyn to Wade, no run hits the deck hard and Wade has to bend and quickly weave out of the way, Steyn's on fire
Steyn to Wade, no run moves away from the left-hander and Wade safely lets that go
Philander to Hussey, no run moves away a touch wider outside off and he shoulders arms
Philander to Hussey, 1 run chance for a run-out! Hussey punched that with soft hands down to short cover, Amla ran forward and took aim at the striker's end and Wade would have been out by a mile
Philander to Wade, no run moves across and safely leaves it alone to the keeper
Philander to Wade, no run Philander hits the deck hard and the batsman bends and leaves it alone, the ball's flying all over the place
Philander to Wade, 1 run haven't seen too many on the pads, tucked this one towards square leg for a single
Philander to Hussey, no run nicely defended down the track, moves across and blocks it out
Steyn to Wade, no run moves across the left-hander and he lets it go to the keeper
Steyn to Wade, no run slightly closer to the off stump and he leaves it alone
Steyn to Wade, FOUR runs risky! It was fuller and shaping away, Wade couldn't resist driving at it and it was on the up and wide of gully
Steyn to Wade, no run short of a length and he leaves it to the keeper
Steyn to Wade, no run short of a length and he punches it towards point
Steyn to Wade, no run good length on the middle stump and he jabs it to the off side
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run That's good running, punched softly towards cover and Hussey set off, Wade responded early to the call this time and hence the single was completed easily
Morkel to Wade, no run good length on the off stump and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Wade, no run good length outside off and he taps it to the off side
Morkel to Wade, no run strays down the leg side this time and he tries to work it down to fine leg
Morkel to Wade, no run loose delivery full and wide outside off, too wide for Wade to chase
Morkel to Wade, no run this was closer to the off stump, well left by Wade
Steyn to Hussey, no run was half forward and got an outside edge of sorts that rolled towards point
Steyn to Hussey, no run bangs it in short and Hussey has to quickly duck under that one
Steyn to Hussey, FOUR runs shot Huss! This was a half volley from Steyn, rare bad ball, outside off and was well forward and didn't hit it too hard, found the gap at cover
Steyn to Hussey, no run short of a length and he safely leaves it alone to the keeper
Steyn to Hussey, no run keeps it just outside off and Hussey safely leaves it alone
Steyn to Hussey, no run little wide of the off stump and he leaves it alone
Philander to Wade, no run comes over the wicket, good length on the off stump and he comes across and defends
Philander to Wade, SIX runs shot of intent and it's gone all the way! Philander banged that in short, sat up nicely for Wade to fetch that from the off stump and club it flat over square leg
Philander to Wade, no run gets across and he defends to the off side

Philander to Wade, FOUR runs edged! Down to the vacant third slip region., this one kicked up a bit and had Wade fending at it, the third slip was taken out and placed on the off side and the other slips could only watch
Philander to Wade, 1 run fuller on the pads and easily worked down to fine leg
Philander to Hussey, no run length ball outside off and left alone
Morkel to Wade, no run comes over the wicket, lands it outside the off just leaves the left-hander
Morkel to Wade, no run similar delivery, good angle from over the wicket, just leaving the off stump and left alone
Morkel to Wade, FOUR runs lovely shot! This was fuller and angling across him and he just stood at the crease and timed that punch crisply past mid-off and cover, just used the pace of the ball
Morkel to Wade, 2 runs drifts on the pads and he tucks it away to the on side
Morkel to Wade, no run tries to tuck it away to the on side and the ball hits his thigh pad and rolls away
Morkel to Wade, no run fuller delivery and he leaves it alone
Philander to Hussey, no run fuller delivery and he gets well across and pushes it towards point
Philander to Hussey, no run that was a risky leave! The ball sailed over the off and middle stumps and it was a last-second decision to let it go
Philander to Hussey, 1 run good length on middle and leg and tucked away for a quick single
Philander to Wade, 2 runs on the pads and tucked down to fine leg, good save by Morkel near the rope

Philander to Wade, 3 runs brilliant save by Morkel! It was short and Wade pulled it and the ball was gaining ground towards deep square leg, Morkel sprinted from fine leg and just about pulled it back on the slide
Philander to Hussey, no run keeps it outside the off stump and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Wade, no run tries to flick it away but Amla gets in the way at short leg
Morkel to Wade, no run sharp bouncer from round the wicket, Wade tries to hook but the ball was too quick for him
Morkel to Wade, no run little short and Wade was forward and he ended up fending it towards gully
Morkel to Wade, no run good length on the off stump and he stabs it down to short cover
Morkel to Wade, no run this length is testing the left-hander, he was half forward and ended up stabbing it high on the bat towards gully
Morkel to Wade, 2 runs too straight and tucked just wide of Amla at short leg, fine leg mops up
Peterson to Hussey, no run comes forward and blocks it to the on side
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run gets forward and tucks it wide of short leg
Peterson to Wade, 1 run comes round the wicket, tossed up and he works it down to square leg
Peterson to Hussey, no run flatter delivery and he tucks it to the on side
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run flatter one again and worked towards square leg
Peterson to Wade, FOUR runs tossed up and Wade gets on his knee early and sweeps it hard down to deep square leg
Morkel to Hussey, no run Morkel falls over after delivery, it left the left-hander and carried through nicely to the keeper, well worth the effort
Morkel to Hussey, no run hits the deck harder and he safely ducks under it
Morkel to Hussey, no run in that corridor outside off and I tell you that was very very close to the off stump! Brave leave
Morkel to Hussey, no run traps him high on the pads, it skidded through and Hussey couldn't work it away
Morkel to Hussey, no run fuller delivery from round the wicket and he prods forward and gets an inside edge to the pads
Morkel to Hussey, no run testing over comes to an end! This was a length ball and pacy one too, Hussey was half forward, not sure what to do, ended up awkwardly fending it to short leg
Peterson to Wade, no run continues round the wicket, prods forward and defends
Peterson to Wade, no run flatter one and he gets forward and across to defend
Peterson to Wade, no run tossed up on middle and he gets forward and blocks
Peterson to Wade, SIX runs Peterson tosses it up a bit more and Wade skips down the track and lofts crisply over wide long-on, top shot
Peterson to Wade, no run risky! Goes for the sweep, doesn't come off well and ends up top edging it and it drops short of short fine leg
Peterson to Wade, no run down the leg side and he pads it away
Morkel to Hussey, no run Morkel continues to probe away at Hussey, just outside off and he opts to leave it alone
Morkel to Hussey, no run gets some bat on it, closer to the off stump and forced him to play, softly pushed to the off side
Morkel to Hussey, no run lets this one go outside off, length ball and he comes across and leaves it alone
Morkel to Hussey, no run a touch too wide outside off, fuller too and Hussey's not taking any risks
Morkel to Hussey, no run little shorter in length and he steers it down to du Plessis at the off side
Morkel to Hussey, no run gets him hopping at the crease, shorter and he manages to defend it, Morkel's testing Hussey again
Peterson to Wade, no run tossed up and fuller outside off and he pushes it down to cover

Peterson to Wade, FOUR runs you can't bowl flat and short and expect to get away with it, Wade gives the poor ball the treatment by rocking back and punching wide of square to bring up the 50 stand, crucial one for Australia
Peterson to Wade, no run
Peterson to Wade, 1 run down the track and he pushes a low full toss down to long-on, field more defensive now
Peterson to Hussey, no run chips down the track and checks his shot, works it to the on side
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run flatter and quicker and worked to the on side to bring up the 100
Morkel to Hussey, no run Morkel bangs it in short from round the wicket and Hussey has to duck to evade it
Morkel to Hussey, no run good length outside off and leaves the left-hander late and he leaves it alone

Morkel to Hussey, OUT the constant probing over the last two and a half overs have paid off for Morkel! Morkel had complete control over Hussey over that period and really set this up, this was pitched up a bit more from round the wicket, on the channel outside off, Hussey had to play at it and got a
Morkel to Hastings, no run just short of a length outside off and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Hastings, no run a touch short outside off and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Hastings, no run close call! This one lifted off the good length and Hastings was on his toes as the ball left him
Peterson to Wade, no run
Peterson to Wade, SIX runs and in no time at all Wade's got a fifty! What a way to get there, tossed up from round the wicket, on middle and leg and chips down the launches it over deep midwicket
Peterson to Wade, no run flatter and shorter and pulled straight to short fine leg
Peterson to Wade, no run comes well forward and defends
Peterson to Wade, 1 run chips it and it's just wide of Amla at forward short leg, too tough to take that one
Peterson to Hastings, no run flatter delivery and safely blocked out
Morkel to Wade, no run Morkel continues round the wicket, Wade safely leaves it alone, how will Wade fare against Morne now?
Morkel to Wade, no run this one moved in quite a bit after pitching and Wade watched it through all the way
Morkel to Wade, no run 142 kph, quick bouncer this time and Wade was down really quickly to get out of the way
Morkel to Wade, FOUR runs this man's in sublime form folks, not a bad ball at all, good length shaping in, Wade made sure he was on the back foot quickly and was in position to punch it wide of cover
Morkel to Wade, no run lands on middle and he stays back and defends
Morkel to Wade, no run this was fuller outside off and he watched it through to the keeper
Philander to Hastings, no run fuller delivery and he defends it to point
Philander to Hastings, no run slightly short and he gets well across and defends
Philander to Hastings, no run
Philander to Hastings, 1 run had to really scamper for his first run in Test cricket! He stabbed it down to point and timed his dive well enough to beat the throw by Dean Elgar
Philander to Wade, no run short of a length and he punches it towards the off side
Philander to Wade, FOUR runs edged and over the slips! It was short and too inviting though, had to smash that somewhere, even Garner couldn't have caught that, fancy Big Bird at slip!
Steyn to Hastings, 1 leg bye on the pads and he clips it off his pads to fine leg
Steyn to Wade, no run lovely punch off the back foot but straight to the fielder at cover
Steyn to Wade, no run good length on the off stump and he covers the line and defends
Steyn to Wade, no run 139 kph, sharp bouncer this time and Wade does well to get under it quickly
Steyn to Wade, no run fuller delivery and he gets across, punches it to mid-off and tells Hastings to wait
Steyn to Wade, no run 137.2 kph, another bouncer but not as steep, Wade was down early enough to evade it
Philander to Hastings, no run that's a jaffa, landed outside and moved a touch away from him, poked his bat at it
Philander to Hastings, no run gets some bat on it and he ends up gliding it towards gully
Philander to Hastings, no run hones in on middle and he shuffles and tucks it down to midwicket, well fielded by Amla
Philander to Hastings, 1 run bit too straight and he clips it wide of Amla who does well to keep it just to a single
Philander to Wade, no run 132 kph, keeps it a touch short and Wade bends his knee slightly and leaves it alone
Philander to Wade, no run moves across his stumps and defends it and that's lunch
Steyn to Hastings, 1 run too straight and tucked away wide of midwicket to ease a single and get Wade on strike
Steyn to Wade, no run comes over the wicket to Wade, comes across and pushes it down the track
Steyn to Wade, no run on a good length and he walks across and defends to the off side
Steyn to Wade, 1 run bangs this one in short and he swivels and pulls forcefully along the turf but Amla's there in the deep to cut it off
Steyn to Hastings, no run this time he bangs it in short and Hastings ducks early
Steyn to Hastings, no run hits a good length and he gets across to defend
Philander to Wade, no run comes over the wicket, gets a nice angle moving away from the off stump and left alone

Philander to Wade, 1 run if it's short he's going to go for it, pulls in front of square and deep midwicket picks it up, there are two fielders in the deep for the big hit but he's keeping it along the ground
Philander to Hastings, no run comes across and pushes it to the off side
Philander to Hastings, no run fuller outside off and he safely leaves it alone
Philander to Hastings, no run nicely pushed towards cover off the full face of the bat
Philander to Hastings, no run good length on the off stump and he gets across and defends
Steyn to Wade, no run on a good length and he gets behind the line and defends
Steyn to Wade, no run fuller in length and he gets across and pushes it back to the bowler
Steyn to Wade, 1 run punches it down to deep point for a single

Steyn to Hastings, 1 run escapes another run-out! Hastings punched it towards cover and set off, the throw by Elgar to the bowler's end was wide and Hastings dived, too bad there was nobody at the stumps, action replay of Hastings' first run in Tests
Steyn to Wade, no run comes across and defends this back to the bowler
Steyn to Wade, no run
Philander to Hastings, 2 runs another risky run, he tucked this one in front of fine leg but Steyn's throw wasn't accurate, he bounced it to de Villiers who failed to gather
Philander to Hastings, no run little short and he defends it to the off side
Philander to Hastings, no run not much movement off the seam, Hastings goes right back and defends
Philander to Hastings, 1 run a bit too straight and he tucks it behind square on the on side
Philander to Wade, no run this was much fuller, perhaps looking to swing it, Wade was right behind it to punch it to mid-off
Philander to Wade, 1 run not quite the line, on the body and easily tucked away to square leg
Steyn to Wade, no run beats him! From over the wicket, lands on off and moves away slightly, Wade did well to not poke his bat out too far
Steyn to Wade, no run comes forward and pushes it towards cover
Steyn to Wade, 1 run too straight and Wade easily knocks it in front of midwicket and calls
Steyn to Hastings, no run 141 kph, hammers this one short and Hastings is quick to get under that one
Steyn to Hastings, no run that was a brute of a delivery! Hastings ducked and the ball clipped his arm guard and lobbed to the keeper who had to leap but couldn't hang on
Steyn to Hastings, no run comes well across and punches it to the off side
Philander to Wade, no run Philander continues over the wicket, not getting any movement at all, left alone to the keeper
Philander to Wade, no run good length outside off and he gets across and knocks it to the off side
Philander to Wade, no run pitched it up and invited the drive and he placed it straight to short extra cover
Philander to Wade, no run another fuller one outside off and pushed down to short extra cover
Philander to Wade, 1 run tucked it towards mid-on and Philander did really well to dart across and turn around and take aim, missed the target though
Philander to Hastings, 3 runs half volley outside the off stump and Hastings drives and beats mid-off, cheers from the crowd, boos as the ball slows down near the rope
Steyn to Hastings, 1 run nicely tucked away wide of midwicket, Hastings giving good support to Wade
Steyn to Wade, no run lands it on the off stump and Wade punches it down to mid-on
Steyn to Wade, no run Steyn too not getting any movement either way, Wade watchfully lets it go to the keeper
Steyn to Wade, no run punches it down to cover and immediately tells his partner to stay back
Steyn to Wade, no run nearly fell for the trap! Fielders in the deep and Steyn dug it in short down the leg side, Wade swivels and pulls and nearly gloves it to the keeper
Steyn to Wade, 1 run stays beside the line and steers it down to point
Philander to Wade, 1 run this was wide and Wade couldn't resist a slash, picked up by the sweeper but it was quite safe
Philander to Hastings, no run little short of a length and Hastings and defends and tells Wade to wait
Philander to Hastings, FOUR runs looked a touch risky at first, it was short and wide and Hastings did well to open the face, ride the bounce and guide it over the slips
Philander to Hastings, no run this time Philander gets it into the right-hander, Hastings goes back and comfortably defends
Philander to Hastings, no run a touch fuller and he gets his pad across and leaves it alone
Philander to Hastings, no run nicely back and across to defend, keeps it on the off stump
Morkel to Wade, no run comes round the wicket to Wade, not much pace on that and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Wade, no run a touch fuller outside off and this time it moves away slightly before reaching the keeper
Morkel to Wade, no run moves away again after pitching and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Wade, no run kicked up a bit more and he comes half forward and stabs it to gully
Morkel to Wade, no run fuller and moving away and he leaves it alone
Morkel to Wade, no run gets beside the line and pushes it towards cover point
Peterson to Hastings, no run
Peterson to Hastings, no run tossed up and Hastings goes for the drive and gets an outside edge past slip
Peterson to Hastings, no run oh well and this one straightens and beats the bat, more of those, Robin
Peterson to Hastings, 1 run quicker and fuller and clipped away wide of midwicket

Peterson to Wade, OUT Look at Peterson celebrate! Tossed up outside off and Wade wanted to slog that away and he missed it completely and it went straight through, Wade just stood in that position knowing he shouldn't have played that, Peterson runs to his right and lets out a war cry
Peterson to Johnson, 1 run tossed up and he lunges forward and pushes it to the off side
Morkel to Johnson, no run good length outside off and he punches it to the off side
Morkel to Johnson, no run Johnson gets a nasty one on the arm and ribs, it was too quick for him and couldn't withdraw, he's doing ok
Morkel to Johnson, 1 run short of a length again and he knocks it to the on side for a single
Morkel to Hastings, 1 run signs of swing there, came back in and he tucked it towards short mid-on where Steyn fumbles
Morkel to Johnson, 2 runs fullish in length outside off and he drives him wide of cover, nice shot to get things going
Morkel to Johnson, no run fuller delivery and he gets across and leaves it alone
Peterson to Hastings, 1 run tossed up and gently pushed down to mid-on
Peterson to Johnson, 1 run no turn at all, he stays back and punches it towards cover
Peterson to Hastings, no run tossed up, no turn and softly blocked out
Peterson to Hastings, no run
Peterson to Hastings, 1 run floated on middle and leg and he works it towards square leg
Peterson to Johnson, 1 run tossed up and he works it down to mid-on for a single
Morkel to Johnson, no run keeps it outside off and Johnson doesn't offer a shot
Morkel to Johnson, no run keeps it a bit short and Johnson is circumspect and withdraws the shot, the ball bounces off his arm
Morkel to Johnson, no run Johnson tries to chop down a tree with one swift stroke and instead the ball catches the underedge and tamely rolls to the off side
Morkel to Johnson, no run lands outside off and he leaves it alone

Morkel to Johnson, no run Appeal for a caught behind and the umpire shakes his head and South Africa are reviewing it, it was short and wide outside off and Johnson tried to smash that over backward point, they all went up because they thought they heard a sound, there was no deviation so it only coul
Morkel to Johnson, no run and he nearly edges it again! All happening here, this was a length ball a touch too wide of the off stump and he slashed at it, close to the bat
Peterson to Hastings, no run tossed up and he tucks it to the on side
Peterson to Hastings, no run tries to clip it to the on side and he gets hit on the pad and Peterson appeals, that was missing leg
Peterson to Hastings, FOUR runs Hastings decides to give that a whack, this was floated on middle and leg and he lofyed it over midwicket, used his wrists well
Peterson to Hastings, FOUR runs make that two in two! Tossed up and Hastings came forward and lofted it crisply over midwicket
Peterson to Hastings, FOUR runs hat-trick of fours! Tossed up and Hastings gets on his knee and slogs him clean over midwicket, one bounce and four
Peterson to Hastings, no run goes back and knocks it to the on side, the lull after the storm
Morkel to Johnson, no run Morkel loses control of this one and slides it down the leg side, no shot offered
Morkel to Johnson, no run shows the full face of the bat and punches it well but can't beat Morkel
Morkel to Johnson, 1 run good length but too straight, shuffles and tucks it to the on side
Morkel to Hastings, no run the bouncer and Hastings doesn't play that well, he weaved away from it rather late but got his glove out of the way
Morkel to Hastings, no run takes his eyes off another bouncer! Only this time though it hits the body, held his bat up and managed to fend it off towards short leg
Morkel to Hastings, no run good length outside off and punched to the off side
Peterson to Johnson, no run over the wicket to Johnson, stays back and defends
Peterson to Johnson, no run no turn at all and he softly pushes it back to the bowler
Peterson to Johnson, no run flatter delivery and he works it to the on side
Peterson to Johnson, no run stays back and defends it very late

Peterson to Johnson, OUT another left-hander is bowled off the slog! Is this an epidemic or what? Peterson's lapping it up, tossed up on middle and it didn't turn, held its line and hit the middle stump, Johnson holds the pose on his knees, head bowed, Australia nine down
Peterson to Starc, no run comes forward and he pushes it to the off side
Morkel to Hastings, no run just short of a length and he stays back and defends
Morkel to Hastings, no run Hastings gets a short and wide one outside off and he half heartedly tries to slash that

Peterson to Hastings, OUT wow! Super catch at the boundary to round off the innings! Hastings sees the flight and looks to smash that over long-off, Alviro Petersen cupped the catch over his head, realised quickly that he was back-pedalling too far and was inches away from the rope, had the presence o

Quite a frenetic few hours of cricket, with Australia falling behind by 62 runs. South Africa have an advantage few would have predicted after they were bowled out for 225. Thanks to some incisive seam bowling by Steyn, Morkel and Philander. Peterson helped himself to three wickets, courtesy two ungainly slo
Innings Start
Steyn stops short at the delivery stride
